arduinoLight.channelprovider.generator.ambientlight

Class Screenselection

  • java.lang.Object
    • arduinoLight.channelprovider.generator.ambientlight.Screenselection

  • public class Screenselection
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a relative screen part (i.e. 'top left quarter' == (r0c0 = true)(r0c1 = false)(... = false)). This class is thread-safe (Java-monitor-pattern).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Screenselection(int columns, int rows)
      Creates a new Screenselection with the specified Amount of Rows and Columns.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeMatrixsize(int newColCount, int newRowCount)
      Creates a new matrix that contains the old matrix as good as possible.
      void clearMatrix()
      Sets every cell of the matrix to false.
      boolean getCell(int x, int y)
      Returns the value of a cell.
      int getColumns()
      Returns the Amount of Columns.
      int getRows()
      Returns the Amount of Rows.
      void setCell(int x, int y, boolean flag)
      Sets a cell to the given 'flag'-value.
      boolean[][] toBooleanArray()
      Returns a copy of the complete matrix.

        y - the Row of the cell

              int y)

      • toBooleanArray

        public boolean[][] toBooleanArray()
        Returns a copy of the complete matrix.

      • changeMatrixsize

        public void changeMatrixsize(int newColCount,
                    int newRowCount)
        Creates a new matrix that contains the old matrix as good as possible. If the new one is bigger, the old one is copied into the new one. If the new one is smaller, the new one is a subsection of the old one.
        Parameters:
        newColCount - new Amount of Columns
        newRowCount - new Amount of Rows

      • clearMatrix

        public void clearMatrix()
        Sets every cell of the matrix to false.

      • getColumns

        public int getColumns()
        Returns the Amount of Columns.

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Returns the Amount of Rows.
